evidence.text: Defendant’s uses of the CEB have disproportionately excluded African-American applicants from employment in these positions

add_extracted.value: Use of Comprehensive Examination Battery (CEB) since 2015 for screening entry-level firefighter applicants, which disproportionately excluded African-American applicants

evidence.text: Approximately 37% of African-American test-takers failed the written test, and approximately 11% of white test-takers failed.

add_extracted.value: Pass/fail rates: 37% African-American test-takers failed vs. 11% white test-takers (statistically significant disparity)

evidence.text: Approximately 32% of African-American applicants who were eligible for an interview failed to receive an invitation to interview, and approximately 14% of white applicants who were eligible for an interview failed to receive an invitation.

add_extracted.value: Ranking of applicants by written test scores led to lower interview invitations for African-American applicants (32% vs. 14% failure rate)

evidence.text: The CEB and the methods in which Defendant has used the CEB are not job related and consistent with business necessity.

add_extracted.value: CEB not job-related or consistent with business necessity, violating Title VII
